bug.short_desc: Get rid of compile warnings in official build

long_desc.thetext: All but the one reported on AptConfigurationBlock are related to the fact that org.eclipse.jdt.core bundle stil is not generified as it's still at 1.4 level. So, either we have to live with this or find a way to exempt these projects from these warnings.

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #2) > All but the one reported on AptConfigurationBlock are related to the fact > that org.eclipse.jdt.core bundle stil is not generified as it's still at 1.4 > level. So, either we have to live with this or find a way to exempt these > projects from these warnings.
Did you really look at the warnings reported by bug 418599? Those are all about unnecessary @SuppressWarnings annotations. The reason for this is that the build does not report unavoidable generic type problems (the thing you just asked for ;-). So, you also need to set the same option on your projects and remove the unnecessary @SuppressWarnings annotations.

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #3) > Did you really look at the warnings reported by bug 418599? Those are all > about unnecessary @SuppressWarnings annotations. The reason for this is that > the build does not report unavoidable generic type problems (the thing you > just asked for ;-). So, you also need to set the same option on your > projects and remove the unnecessary @SuppressWarnings annotations.
Matter of fact, I did. But I failed to see the relevance the 'Ignore unavoidable ...' option had on this. I was confused that I couldn't replicate the unused warnings on my local workspace just with the 'Suppress ... " options.

Interestingly the following three files were not reported even though they have similar problem too:
AnnotationDeclarationImpl.java ClassDeclarationImpl.java EclipseDeclarationImpl.java

http://download.eclipse.org/eclipse/downloads/drops4/N20131005-1500/compilelogs/plugins/org.eclipse.jdt.apt.core_3.3.600.N20131005-1500/@dot.html
Looks like there are still some left.

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #8) > Looks like there are still some left.
No, looks like a bug with the JDT compiler used by the build. The warnings appear on my local workspace when I use build I20130918-2000. But not with 4.3.1. I will raise a bug for this after a bit more experiment.

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #9) > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #8) > > Looks like there are still some left. > > No, looks like a bug with the JDT compiler used by the build. The warnings > appear on my local workspace when I use build I20130918-2000. But not with > 4.3.1. I will raise a bug for this after a bit more experiment.
The build correctly reports the warnings and in fact you say yourself that you see them with I20130918-2000. So, you just have to fix them. 4.3.1 has absolutely nothing to do with this bug (the code is from 'master' and the official build uses the 4.4 M2 compiler).

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #10) > (In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #9) > > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #8) > > > Looks like there are still some left. > > > > No, looks like a bug with the JDT compiler used by the build. The warnings > > appear on my local workspace when I use build I20130918-2000. But not with > > 4.3.1. I will raise a bug for this after a bit more experiment. > > The build correctly reports the warnings and in fact you say yourself that > you see them with I20130918-2000. So, you just have to fix them. 4.3.1 has > absolutely nothing to do with this bug (the code is from 'master' and the > official build uses the 4.4 M2 compiler).
What I meant by I20130918-2000 and M2 is the eclipse SDK version I used to load the JDT/Core source. If the unavoidableGenericTypeProblems is disabled, why should I still get warnings?

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #11) > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #10) > > (In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #9) > > > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #8) > > > > Looks like there are still some left. > > > > > > No, looks like a bug with the JDT compiler used by the build. The warnings > > > appear on my local workspace when I use build I20130918-2000. But not with > > > 4.3.1. I will raise a bug for this after a bit more experiment. > > > > The build correctly reports the warnings and in fact you say yourself that > > you see them with I20130918-2000. So, you just have to fix them. 4.3.1 has > > absolutely nothing to do with this bug (the code is from 'master' and the > > official build uses the 4.4 M2 compiler). > > What I meant by I20130918-2000 and M2 is the eclipse SDK version I used to > load the JDT/Core source. If the unavoidableGenericTypeProblems is disabled, > why should I still get warnings?
Because those are not falling under that umbrella.

(In reply to Dani Megert from comment #12) > Because those are not falling under that umbrella.
You are right, but apparently not before bug 338350 was fixed, and that explains why I didn't see the warnings with 4.3.1. But looking at the code, one of them is a straight forward fix but other two deal with Collection and not a straight forward fix. So, I think we better 'suppress' these and live with the 'other' warning.

(In reply to Jayaprakash Arthanareeswaran from comment #13) > (In reply to Dani Megert from comment #12) > > Because those are not falling under that umbrella. > > You are right, but apparently not before bug 338350 was fixed, and that > explains why I didn't see the warnings with 4.3.1. But looking at the code, > one of them is a straight forward fix but other two deal with Collection and > not a straight forward fix. So, I think we better 'suppress' these and live > with the 'other' warning.
There was no 'other' warning involved here. Sorry for the confusion. I have fixed these via:
http://git.eclipse.org/c/jdt/eclipse.jdt.core.git/commit/?id=752997c49fce93f7eee6cf57e4f36abf3d0c7f48
